a shooting star; and death surprises us like an electric shock!
And also Mr. Schermerhorn, you never feel that a good story should be
wasted. You prefer the coloured picture to the black and white.
Well, both of them show where the truth lies, but itrs a whole heap more
fun in colour! How are you making out there, Mr, Tocqueville?
I shall not be long now! I am just making notes of the last parties that
we attended.
Oh those terrible parties. What did you think of them, Mr. Beaumont?
Most interesting.
There’s a tactful man. How do you like American ladies?
Their fascination is exceeded only by their remarkable virtue.
